titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Robert Lee Frost (1874-1963) was a well-known American poet who won the Pulitzer Prize four times. Beginning in 1929, Frost and Joseph Blumenthal of the Spiral Press issued holiday cards containing a poem by Frost.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Robert Frost poems. Materials include a notebook containing manuscript poems by Frost along with two typed transcripts and a nearly complete collection of Frost's Christmas poems issued by Spiral Press between 1929 and 1962. Some of these are present in multiple copies. The collection also includes miscellaneous writings on Frost, photographs and transcripts of letters from 1913 and 1925, and two additional imprints of poems.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
